definition: to sink into (vice, depravity etc)/to pass into oblivion/downfall/passing
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
see 黑沉沉[hei1 chen1 chen1]
to sink (into ruin, oblivion)/to be reduced to

sentences.english: Perishes , only blames opening which oneself has not put.
sentences.chinese: 沉沦，只怪，臫巳还没能学会放旳开。

sentences.english: That a separate the world empty thoughts, like poison, always let a person willing to sink.
sentences.chinese: 那一份隔世离空的思念，宛如毒药，总让人甘愿沉沦。

sentences.english: The sky became dark down, falling under the west rain silk.
sentences.chinese: 南国的天空变得阴晦沉沦，飘落下丝丝西雨。

sentences.english: Jealous is a disease, it will spend out.
sentences.chinese: 妬忌是一种疾病，会传染开去，令人沉沦。

sentences.english: The feeble-minded, like Loughner, are the first to sink.
sentences.chinese: 愚钝如Loughner者，正是沉沦的第一位。

sentences.english: I can only be used to replace the sink and forget my pain.
sentences.chinese: 我只能用忘记和沉沦来代替我的痛苦。

sentences.english: And in every sort of evil that deceives those who are perishing .
sentences.chinese: 并且在那沉沦的人身上，行各样出于不义的诡诈。

sentences.english: Thou strik'st the dull peasant-he sinks in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 你击倒了平庸的农民，他沉沦于黑夜。

sentences.english: Surely you place them on slippery ground; you cast them down to ruin.
sentences.chinese: 你实在把他们安在滑地，使他们掉在沉沦之中。

sentences.english: The possibility of a return to university faded as the delusions overwhelmed her.
sentences.chinese: 随着她沉沦于这一妄想，返校复读的希望逐渐消失。

sentences.english: These are the fundamental reasons for the historical degradation of both Chinese and Wester…
sentences.chinese: 这是中西美学走向其历史沉沦的根本原因。

sentences.english: Do not sink, in any environment you can choose to rise.
sentences.chinese: 不要沉沦，在任何环境中你都可以选择奋起。

sentences.english: For the Lord knoweth the way of the just: and the way of the wicked shall perish.
sentences.chinese: 因上主赏识义人的行径，恶人的行径必自趋沉沦。

sentences.english: But there are times when it's wiser to take a risk than to wallow in the mud of mundanity.
sentences.chinese: 然而，有些时候冒点风险比在世俗中沉沦要明智。

sentences.english: Bath naked she drips rich. Jim falls into her and is devoured.
sentences.chinese: 她赤裸着沐浴在丰富的泡沫中，吉姆贪婪地沉沦。

sentences.english: As this stock stinks and sinks, will Buffett build his position or cut his losses?
sentences.chinese: 随着该股的沉沦，巴菲特是会增持，还是会忍痛割肉？

definition: to degrade/to degenerate/to become depraved/corrupt/a fall from grace
to lose (one's bearings)/to get lost
depressed/bad mood/low spirit
abyss
to indulge in/to wallow/absorbed in/deeply engrossed/addicted
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
to be deeply in (trouble, debt etc)/deep set (eyes)
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
deeply immersed/fig. wallowing in/deeply engrossed in
to fall deeper and deeper (in debt, in love etc)
to free oneself/to extricate oneself from a difficult situation
desperate straits
to abandon oneself to despair/to give up and stop bothering
swamp
to struggle
to indulge in/to wallow in
